channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At Emotional Event With Oprah, Kamala Harris Hits Core Campaign Themes
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris spoke off the cuff, as guests included a teenager shot at her school and the family of a woman in Georgia who died as a r...

item.title: Israel Strikes Lebanon in Wake of Hezbollah Threat to Retaliate, Officials Say
item.description: Israel carried out one of the most intense bombardments of the past year, as warplanes launched 70 airstrikes, Lebanese security officials said. The b...

item.title: Italy set to regain its spot as world’s largest wine producer—overtaking France
item.description: Due to unfavorable weather affecting French vineyards, Italy is poised to surpass France as the world's largest wine producer this year.

item.title: Dictators Die, but Their Legacies Live on Much Longer
item.description: Fujimori’s authoritarian streak lives on in Peru, even in those who claim to be against the former leader’s political movement.

item.title: Europe’s New Defense Chief: ‘A King Without a Kingdom’?
item.description: The European Union has vowed to enhance its military capability. But money is scarce, responsibilities overlap and the new job is less about soldiers ...

item.title: Beds sold at Amazon, Walmart recalled due to collapse hazard
item.description: The recall covers a discontinued version of its platform beds, which the company says were manufactured between 2019 and 2021.

item.title: Europe’s New Defense Chief: ‘A King Without a Kingdom’?
item.description: The European Union has vowed to enhance its military capability. But money is scarce, responsibilities overlap and the new job is less about soldiers ...

item.title: How Israel’s Technological Trojan Horse Destabilized Hezbollah
item.description: The explosion of devices carried by thousands of Hezbollah operatives sowed panic sowed panic and overwhelmed hospitals across Lebanon. Sheera Frenkel...

item.title: Gen Z needs more than a paycheck at work—here’s how I deliver as CEO
item.description: Rather than resisting Gen Z’s instinct to carve their own career paths and seek purpose-driven work, leaders can nurture it.

item.title: Trump Says That if He Loses, ‘the Jewish People Would Have a Lot to Do’ With It
item.description: Speaking at a campaign event denouncing antisemitism in America, Donald Trump again attacked Jews who vote for Democrats, saying that the party had a ...

item.title: Mali Attack Killed 50 or More, but Leaders Say Little
item.description: Days after the West African country’s ruling military was ambushed by Islamist rebels, it has sought to hide the true extent of the carnage.

item.title: Nike welcomes new CEO with $27 million payday
item.description: Veteran executive Elliott Hill retired from the retailer in 2020—and he’s back.

item.title: Kentucky Sheriff Arrested in Shooting Death of Judge
item.description: The police say a sheriff shot District Judge Kevin Mullins inside the courthouse on Thursday afternoon before turning himself in.

item.title: Mohamed al-Fayed, Former Harrods Owner, Accused of Raping 5 Women
item.description: Multiple former employees told the BBC they had been raped or sexually assaulted by the billionaire businessman, who died last year.

item.title: America ranks worst in the world for health care—despite spending trillions
item.description: The U.S. came in last in three of five categories—equity, health outcomes, and access to care—in addition to having the poorest overall ranking.
